title: [Large-Scale] Linear Inverse Problem Signal Restoration Education Course Using Deep Unfolding

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental Linear Algebra, Signal Processing Concepts, Python Programming Basics, and Understanding of Neural Network Models
context.additional_context: Applying a blended learning approach that combines theoretical understanding and simple practical exercises in limited-technology environments (smartphone-centric). Includes a case study on near-infrared signal restoration using RGB images

learning_goals: Students can explain the mathematical modeling of inverse linear problems and the fundamental principles of signal restoration
They can comparatively explain the structure of deep unfolding models and their advantages over conventional optimization techniques
They can implement signal restoration problems using multimodal information (e.g., RGB images) with real-world data and evaluate performance

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
